dt: {bc}training, guidance, or discipline derived from experience
{bc}the cost of instruction and maintenance at school
{bc}the training of a horse for service
{bc}the teaching and exercising of horse and rider in the formal techniques of equitation

shortdef: training, guidance, or discipline derived from experience

dt: {bc}to teach or drill in a specific knowledge or skill
{bc}to educate in an institution of learning

dt.t: The child was {wi}schooled{/wi} at great cost to her family.

pt: {sc}teach{/sc} {sc}instruct{/sc} {sc}educate{/sc} {sc}train{/sc} {sc}discipline{/sc} {sc}school{/sc} mean to cause to acquire knowledge or skill. {sc}teach{/sc} applies to any manner of imparting information or skill so that others may learn.

pt.t: {it}taught{/it} us a lot about our planet
more things than formal schooling serve to {it}educate{/it} a person

pt: {sc}train{/sc} stresses instruction and drill with a specific end in view.

pt.t: {it}trained{/it} foreign pilots to operate the new aircraft

pt: {sc}discipline{/sc} implies training in habits of order and precision.
{sc}school{/sc} implies training or disciplining especially in what is hard to master.

shortdef: to teach or drill in a specific knowledge or skill
to discipline or habituate to something
to educate in an institution of learning

dt: {bc}to swim or feed in a school

shortdef: to swim or feed in a school
